User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.7; rv:10.0a1) Gecko/20111017 Firefox/10.0a1
Build ID: 20111017040223

Steps to reproduce:

I had a killer idea for a new feature.


Actual results:

I talked about it for a few minutes on Twitter, and then I decided to file a bug in Bugzilla to ask for it.


Expected results:


I'd like to be able to flag outgoing messages as being something I'm expecting a response to, and to have a smart folder of "Outstanding issues" or "Outstanding replies" so that I can keep track, easily, of the things that I'm expecting to hear back about yet, but haven't. 

A really ambitious implementation might put a flag in the headers (X-Expecting-Reply or something) to flag for the user at the other end that they're hoping to hear back from you, but even without that, for personal use, it seems like it would be quite useful.

Thanks,

- mhoye
comments.author: mhoye@neon.polkaroo.net
comments.creator: mhoye@neon.polkaroo.net

It's not about Thunderbird-as-communications-tool, though that's important, but about growing Thunderbird into a communications organizer; I'd like Thunderbird to know not just what my communications have been in the past, but what I expect from my communication channels in the future.

comments.raw_text:
I suppose I am not being clear - I don't think this is a duplicate, and I'm not asking for a flag to mark my own email as something I need follow up, as per bug 331372. 

What I am asking for is, to be able to mark an _outgoing_ message as being something that I am _expecting_ an answer to. 

That way, I can have a list of message that I have sent out that I haven't received answers to, as an outgoing list of concerns, and I can have Thunderbird inform me when I receive one of those presumably-important replies. 

With that in mind, I would like to remove the resolved-duplicate flag.

The distinction is in the subsequent actions - part of what I'm asking for is functionality that will notify me when I get a response to an email I have flagged as expecting one. 

We can already tag mail in Thunderbird (which may mean that 331372 should be closed, unless a tag is different from a flag somehow?) but I can't a far as I can see leverage that to track or automatically manage outstanding issues that that I'm waiting on response for, from other people.

Further, I don't see an easy way of flagging/tagging an outgoing message while I'm writing it - I need to go into the folder and do it there manually, every time.
